meanings.definition: A small ball of a strong-smelling substance used to deter moths.
meanings.sent1: I placed a mothball in my closet to keep moths away.
meanings.sent2: The old clothes in the attic were protected by mothballs.
meanings.sent3: When the moths saw the mothball, they decided to have a meeting elsewhere.
meanings.sent4: The mothball stood guard, repelling any moth invaders.
meanings.sent5: The pungent odor of the mothball filled the room, ensuring no moths would come near.

meanings.definition: To store or treat with mothballs.
meanings.sent1: She decided to mothball her winter clothes until next year.
meanings.sent2: The antique store owner mothballed the old dresses to preserve them.
meanings.sent3: The idea to mothball the summer dresses until the next season seemed like a good plan.
meanings.sent4: He felt like he had to mothball his emotions to focus on work.
meanings.sent5: The decision to mothball the project was made to revisit it later with fresh eyes.
